26.0: Rav Levi opened his discourse with the text from Isaiah (41:24):
26.1: “Therefore, you are less than nothing (meh-ayin), your effect is less than nullity (meh-afah),
26.2: One who choose you is an abomination.”
26.3: Meh-ayin means: nothing at all, from a foul secretion.
26.4: Meh-afah means: from the one hundred cries (ma’ah pe’ayot) a woman utters when she gives birth, when it is a case of ninety nine chance of death and one of life…
26.5: Even though the infant emerges from the womb filthy and soiled, full of secretions and blood,
26.6: all embrace and kiss it, especially so if it is a male.
